feed.title: SAP Community - SAP HANA
feed.subtitle: SAP HANA Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: using hdbsql in shell script and query database
entry.content:
Hello,

i want to use hdbsql in a shell script, to run a query for checking database backups. Unfortunately i am only able to login with hdbuserstorekey in my script after that the select statement does not work (select "command not found")

SAPSTRING=$(find /usr/sap/ccms -maxdepth 2 -type d -name sapccmsr | head -n 1 | cut -c 15-17)
HDBSTRING=$(/usr/bin/cat /usr/sap/"$SAPSTRING"/SYS/profile/DEFAULT.PFL | grep dbs/hdb/dbname | awk {' print$3'})
echo "HDB System ID ----------> " $HDBSTRING
declare -l HDBSIDADM
HDBSIDADM=$HDBSTRING'adm'

HDBBACKUPTEST=$(sudo su - "$HDBSIDADM" -c 'hdbsql -c ";" "\c -U HDBUSERSTOREKEY ";" select * from "SYS"."M_BACKUP_CATALOG" " ' )

 

this results in

-bash: select * from SYS.M_BACKUP_CATALOG : command not found

 

seems like that after the successful connect with hdbuserstorekey, it closes the connection and so the select command is not known.

any ideas?

 

thanks in advance

entry.title: Error on GR for PO in previous Fiscal. GR only possible if PO delievery date is current fiscal year
entry.content:
We cannot do a Goods Receipt on Purchase Orders with delivery dates in the previous financial year as we get an ABAP Dump. If we change the date to any date in the current year a GR is possible. 

I  have never experienced this error at Year end before

entry.title: Can you link/join a MATDOC record to the corresponding idoc record
entry.content: Can you link/join a MATDOC table record to the corresponding idoc record for that MATDOC entry?  Looking for a way to positively identify which idoc record is responsible for any given entry in the MATDOC table.

entry.title: Transforming Healthcare Procurement: Lessons from Our S/4HANA MM Implementation
entry.content:
Introduction

When our healthcare organization decided to migrate from SAP ECC to S/4HANA, the procurement team faced a critical challenge: how do we transform decades-old processes while ensuring uninterrupted supply of life-saving medical supplies? As the SAP MM consultant leading this implementation, I learned valuable lessons that could benefit others embarking on similar journeys.

The Challenge

Healthcare procurement is uniquely complex. Unlike typical manufacturing or retail, we had to contend with:

  • Regulatory compliance: Medical devices and pharmaceuticals require strict traceability
  • Just-in-time criticality: Stock-outs can literally cost lives
  • Complex approval chains: Clinical, financial, and safety approvals needed for different item categories
  • Integration with IS-H: Patient care systems must seamlessly communicate with procurement

Our legacy ECC system had grown organically over 15 years, with customizations layered upon customizations. The procurement cycle averaged 14 days, with 30% of requisitions requiring manual intervention.

Our Approach: Innovation Within S/4HANA

Rather than simply replicating old processes in new technology, we took a transformation approach:

1. Simplified Material Master Data

We reduced material master variants from 12 to 4 by leveraging S/4HANA's Universal Journal. This alone cut data maintenance time by 60%.

Key Innovation: We created a custom Fiori app for clinical staff to request new materials with built-in compliance checks. This reduced incorrect material master requests by 75%.

2. Automated Approval Workflows

Using SAP Workflow and business rules, we automated 70% of approvals:

  • Low-value items (<£500): Auto-approved based on budget holder rules
  • Standard medical supplies: Single-click approval via mobile Fiori
  • High-value/controlled substances: Multi-level workflow with audit trail

Technical Detail: We integrated S/4HANA MM with our IS-H patient safety system, automatically flagging any procurement that could impact patient protocols.

3. Intelligent Inventory Optimization

We implemented SAP Integrated Business Planning (IBP) alongside MM to predict demand based on:

  • Historical patient admission patterns
  • Seasonal variations (flu season, holiday periods)
  • Planned surgical schedules from IS-H

This reduced emergency orders by 45% while cutting inventory holding costs by £380,000 annually.

4. Supplier Collaboration Portal

Built on SAP Ariba integration, we gave suppliers real-time visibility into:

  • Forecast demand
  • Purchase order status
  • Invoice status and payment schedules

Result: Order-to-delivery time dropped from 8 days to 3 days average.

Implementation Challenges & Solutions

Challenge 1: Change Management with Clinical Staff

Problem: Clinicians are notoriously resistant to new systems that take time away from patient care.

Solution:

  • Created role-specific Fiori launchpads (different for doctors, nurses, department managers)
  • Built "emergency override" function for genuine urgent needs
  • Gamified adoption with department leaderboards showing fastest approval times

Result: 94% user adoption within 3 months (vs. industry average of 65-70%).

Challenge 2: IS-H Integration Complexity

Problem: Our patient management system (IS-H) needed real-time inventory data, but standard integration was causing performance issues.

Solution:

  • Implemented SAP CPI (Cloud Platform Integration) for asynchronous data exchange
  • Created custom BAPI for critical real-time queries (e.g., "Is life-saving drug X in stock?")
  • Built caching layer for frequently accessed data

Technical Note: This architecture pattern is now being replicated across our other S/4HANA modules.

Challenge 3: Regulatory Reporting

Problem: Healthcare regulators require specific procurement reports that don't exist in standard S/4HANA.

Solution:

  • Leveraged SAP Analytics Cloud with custom CDS views
  • Created automated monthly reports pushed to regulatory portal
  • Built audit trail dashboard for compliance team

Measurable Results

After 12 months of go-live:

  • Procurement cycle time: 14 days → 4 days (71% reduction)
  • Cost savings: £380,000 annually in inventory optimization
  • Emergency orders: Reduced by 45%
  • User satisfaction: 8.7/10 (vs. 4.2/10 with old system)
  • Compliance audit findings: Zero critical issues (previously averaged 3-4 per year)
  • Supplier relationships: Net Promoter Score increased from 42 to 78

Key Takeaways for Your S/4HANA Healthcare Journey

1. Don't Just "Lift and Shift"

The power of S/4HANA is in process transformation. Challenge every legacy process before migrating it.

2. Invest Heavily in User Experience

Healthcare professionals are time-poor. If your system adds clicks, they'll find workarounds. Fiori customization was our best ROI investment.

3. Integration Architecture is Critical

Healthcare has more interconnected systems than most industries. Plan your integration strategy before configuration.

4. Build for Compliance from Day One

Retrofitting audit trails and regulatory reports is painful. Include compliance experts in your core team.

5. Phased Approach Works Better Than Big Bang

We went live in three phases:

  • Phase 1: Non-critical supplies (office, housekeeping)
  • Phase 2: Standard medical supplies
  • Phase 3: Controlled substances and high-value equipment

This allowed us to learn and adjust before risking patient care.

What's Next?

We're now exploring:

  • AI-powered demand forecasting: Using SAP AI Business Services to predict supply needs based on patient admission ML models
  • Blockchain for pharmaceutical traceability: Piloting SAP's blockchain solution for controlled substance tracking
  • Predictive maintenance: Integrating medical equipment maintenance schedules with spare parts procuremen

    Questions for the Community

    I'd love to hear from others working on healthcare S/4HANA implementations:

    1. How have you approached IS-H integration in your projects?
    2. What mobile solutions have you found most effective for clinical users?
    3. Have you implemented any AI/ML solutions for procurement optimization?

    Conclusion

    S/4HANA migration in healthcare is complex, but with the right approach, it can transform procurement from a bottleneck into a competitive advantage. The key is balancing innovation with the non-negotiable requirement of patient safety.

    If you're planning a similar implementation, feel free to reach out. I'm always happy to share lessons learned and learn from others' experiences.

  •

entry.title: MSR_VRM_GR Complete logistical process with goods receipt is greyed out
entry.content:
Dear Gurus,

i am facing the following issue:

I have stock which is assigned on customer order and must be returned to supplier due to defects.

I create manually Advanced Returns PO.

in VL10B return delivery was created and the customer stock was posted GI.

in MSR_VRM_GR the replacement PO must be created. 

Useually when the stock is not assigned to any sales order then the button "complete logistical process with GR" is active and can be checked.

I wonder why the field "Complete Logistical Process with Goods receipt" is greyed out in case of special stock E?

I dont want to do one more inspection in the warehouse when the goods come back from Vendor. 

Thank you for your advice.

entry.title: Cleared document through H2H is going in payment block in FBL1N in SAP 1909
entry.content: Cleared document through H2H is going in payment block in FBL1N in SAP 1909. Once the payment is cleared then such document should not be in payment block

entry.title: Is debit is '+' and credit is '-' is same in SAP SD & SAP MM ECC & S/4 HANA?
Where does value help for Purchaser Responsible come from in Purchasing category App ?
entry.content:
hello 

In the Manage Purchasing Categories app , the Purchaser Responsible field only shows a few Business Partners — not all employees.

We’ve already checked that:

All missing BPs are of type Person, have role Employee (BUP003), and are linked to Personnel Numbers.

HR integration is active.

So where does the app read the possible values for this field from?

entry.title: Clarification on HANA Runtime compliance
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

I am seeking clarification on two related topics regarding SAP Document and Reporting Compliance (DRC) and SAP HANA Runtime licensing.

Scenario:

  • Customer runs SAP S/4HANA with HANA Runtime Edition for Applications & BW.
  • The customer does not have a DRC subscription.
  • A certified third-party Peppol Access Point is used for sending and receiving electronic invoices (XRechnung / Peppol).
  • The integration add-on runs entirely within the SAP application layer (ABAP), using standard IDoc/BAPI/RFC/Proxy interfaces — no direct database access, no XS, no SQL scripts, and no custom tables in HANA.

Questions:

  1. Is such an add-on architecture compliant under HANA Runtime licensing, or would it require a Full Use Edition?
  2. For outbound e-invoicing (XRechnung/Peppol), is SAP DRC mandatory, or can a third-party Access Point be used directly with standard SAP interfaces?

If possible, I would appreciate an SAP Note reference or official clarification on these points to help guide the architecture decision.

Thank you in advance for your insights.

entry.title: Can not restore SAP HANA 1.0 SP12 COMPLETE_DATA_BACKUP to other server
entry.content:
Hello,

I can not restore COMPLETE_DATA_BACKUP backup from server-db1 to server-db2.

Here is my command

hdbadm@hanadb-01:/usr/sap/HDB/HDB00> HDBSettings.sh recoverSys.py --command="RECOVER DATA USING FILE ('/tmp/data/COMPLETE_DATA_BACKUP_20251016') CLEAR LOG"
[139778227181312, 0.002] >> starting recoverSys (at Thu Oct 16 16:27:49 2025)
[139778227181312, 0.002] args: ()
[139778227181312, 0.002] keys: {'command': "RECOVER DATA USING FILE ('/tmp/data/COMPLETE_DATA_BACKUP_20251016') CLEAR LOG"}
own pid: 24280
recoverSys started: ============2025-10-16 16:27:49 ============
testing master: hanadb-01
hanadb-01 is master
shutdown database, timeout is 120
stop system
stop system: hanadb-01
stopping system: 2025-10-16 16:27:49

creating file recoverInstance.sql
restart database
restart master nameserver: 2025-10-16 16:28:15
start system: hanadb-01
2025-10-16T16:28:24+07:00 P024490 199ec595262 INFO RECOVERY state of service: nameserver, hanadb-01:30001, volume: 1, RecoveryPrepared

recoverSys finished successfully: 2025-10-16 16:28:25
[139778227181312, 36.087] 0
[139778227181312, 36.087] << ending recoverSys, rc = 0 (RC_TEST_OK), after 36.085 secs

Process run very fast and not working

Sorry for my english, Please help

Binh

entry.title: SNOTE: Unknown object type (WDYA)
entry.content:
Hi experts,

I am implementing these notes: 3565339 - ODN Framework - Note Collection.

S4CORE: 106, SAP_BASIS: 756

Where I am getting the error is in this one: 3593722 - ODN Framework - BRF FPM Application.

It seems that SNOTE is not understanding the WDYA type (FPM Application) and it is not creating it:

I tried to implement it in another system (S4CORE: 107, SAP_BASIS: 757), and it is doing it fine:

How can I fix it?
Thanks in advance for the replies!

entry.title: Need Support on RAP application
entry.content:
Hello Guys,

good morning!

I need help on RAP Application.

we have created new RAP application for vendor campaign it involves 3 levels.

1. Campaign Header:  Campaign ID, Key date , Campaign Start date and Campaign End Date.

2. Campaign Items: Campaign ID , Comapny Code, Supplier.

3. Supplier Open Items: Supplier , Document Number , Item and amount.

Now we have requirement to create new multiple campaign items in single click.

we are able to create new single campaign item using abstract entity and action.

but we are not able achieve/select multiple supplier in abstract entity to select multiple and create multiple campaign items in single click.

In abstract entity, we can select only one supplier at a time. We should be able to select multiple supplier.

Could you please assist?

thanks for your support in advance.

regards,

Pramodh

entry.title: Connection Issue Between SAP BTP Trial and S/4HANA On-Premise via Cloud Connector
entry.content:
Hi All,

I’m currently configuring the connectivity between our SAP BTP free trial account and our S/4HANA on-premise system using the Cloud Connector. After completing the setup, I tried to validate the connection between the cloud and on-premise systems, but I encountered an error.

Upon checking the related SAP Note, it seems that the issue might be due to a possible spelling mistake in the host name or a connectivity issue with the internal host.

I have verified that the internal hostname and port are correct, and I also checked in SICF in on-premise system to ensure the correct internal host and port are maintained. However, the connection is still not working. I’m using an HTTPS connection.

Could you please help me resolve this issue?

BR/Kannan.

entry.title: EU Triangular Trading workaround for intercompany invoice
entry.content:
Hi experts!

We have the following scenario in regards of triangular trading for which we need a solution for the intercompany invoices:

We order products in company code XX01 (Danish entity) with an external supplier SUP01 in Czech Republic. We want the products to be delivered to our 3PL distribution center in a different company code XX02 (German entity). Therefore we would have two invoices related to the same PO:

  • The supplier SUP01 should invoice company code XX01 and deliver the goods to company code XX02
  • And then we would need intercompany billing to happen between XX01 and XX02 company codes for these products. (were XX1 is acting as the "supplier" and XX02 is acting as the "buyer")

How could we setup such scenario? Has anyone had a similar situation?

Best regards,

Natalie

entry.title: BAPI_PROCORDCONF_CREATE_TT does not show errors if no stock available (nor COGI!?)
entry.content:
Dear Experts

 

We have been using  co6n and for a long time and it works properly. I am trying to use the bapi BAPI_PROCORDCONF_CREATE_TT to do the same, mostly consumption of materials, in case there is an error (stock is not enough for instance) the movement should go to COGI. We use SP HANA since 2024.

I am testing in Se37 with a test sequence of BAPI_PROCORDCONF_CREATE_TT and later BAPI_TRANSACTION_COMMIT with the "X"

I started with a simple entry in tables TIMETICKETS (record with confirmation number and little more, no yield) GOODSMOVEMENTS and also LINK_CONF_GOODSMOV table.

When I do a confirmation with a simple good movement of 1 unit (I have 10.000 in stock in my test system) all goes well apparently. At least the movement 261 is shown in MB51 and the confirmation is recorded. Only it’s a bit weird that in CORT I do not see the movement attached to the confirmation but for the rest, even the reservation is reduced etc.

The trouble is when I test a wrong movement to create a COGI or “some error”. For instance I enter quantity 999999 in the BAPI to create a cogi.

I get no error or message in BAPI, even it says that the confirmation has been saved. Later after commit, nothing happens.

If I do a similar thing in the same order, it goes to COGI.

SO I am a bit confused 😞
